intro: Diplokeleba, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers emit a strong fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds when mature.
